acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by Beverly Repass Hoch in 2008; material in Folder 2 donated in 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The documents in this collection were purchased by professional genealogist Beverly Repass Hoch from eBay in 2008 and 2011. Mrs. Hoch donated the contents of Folder 4 in 2008 and the contents of Folder 2 in 2011.

did.unittitle: Certificate of Residence. Helen Shelburne. 23 July 1889.

scopecontent.p: Certificate stating that Helen Shelburne, currently age 21, is residing at the home of Rev. A. A. Ferguson, Wytheville, Virginia.

did.unittitle: Letter. John P. Summers, Abingdon, Virginia to County Court Clerk. 21 September 1889.

scopecontent.p: Re: request for search of land records for Henry Copenhaver who died ca. 1827. whose heirs in Iowa are trying to establish claim through his son George Copenhaver.

did.unittitle: Letter. Walter S. Tipton, Hillsville, Virginia to Capt. E. Rogers, Ivanhoe, Virginia. 11 December 1911.

scopecontent.p: Re: congratulations on his recent divorce.

did.unittitle: Letter. Sue M. Young, Mt. Airy Depot, Virginia to Jennie [unknown]. 2 August [unknown].

scopecontent.p: Re: heavy rain, Sunday School at Oak Grove Chapel (later Hawkins Chapel Lutheran Church).

did.unittitle: Letter. B. Estill, Wythe Court House, Virginia to Samuel McCamant, Grayson Court House, Virginia. 19 December 1833.

scopecontent.p: Re: request to check for missing paper in court case of Thompson vs. Sayers et al.

did.unittitle: Letter. Anne Dabney Stuart Brown, Wythe Court House, Virginia to Jane Lewis Stuart Crockett, Christiansburg, Virginia. 10 January 1838.

scopecontent.p: Re: return of husband, James Ewell Brown; her rheumatism; family; slaves Edwin and Rosannah; children of Jane Lewis Crockett including Charles Lewis Crockett, Gustavus Crockett and wife Elizabeth Erskine Crockett, Francis Crockett; death of William Brown's child; and Methodist revival and religion.

did.unittitle: Letter. Mary McKee, Wytheville, Virginia to Eliza McKee, c/o Mrs. Jno. McKee, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. 30 December 1841

scopecontent.p: Re: Christmas and spiritual matters; Methodist church and preachers; illness of their uncle, Adam McKee; Dr. Chapman of Philadelphia; Emory and Henry College ministers; teacher Jane Hamilton Childs; and family.

did.unittitle: Letter. John Ewing, Wythe County, Virginia to James V. Ewing, Lewisburg, Marshall County, Tennessee. 10 June 1843.

scopecontent.p: Re: sickness in Wythe County; death of Catherine Painter, widow of Mathias Painter; illness of wife Polly (Mary) Ewing; Henry Ewing; drinking of Joshua Ewing; plans for his tannery.

did.unittitle: Letter. Robert Gibboney, Wytheville, Virginia to Hugh M. Sheffey, Richmond, Virginia. 15 January 1849.

scopecontent.p: Re: payment for creditors of Hayden H. Bell.

did.unittitle: Letter. Charles B. Shaw, Wytheville, Virginia to A. B. McFarlan, Washington, D. C.. 18 April 1849.
Letter. Thomas Wood, Max Meadows, Virginia to Anne E. Wood, Poplar Hill, Giles County, Virginia. 5 August 1879.

scopecontent.p: Re: her stay and treatment at Pulaski Alum Springs; his trip home; neighbors including Joseph Crockett; Guy Sanders; his incredulity at how ladies walk in high heeled shoes on macadamized streets in Newbern, Virginia.

did.unittitle: Letter. I. H. Rhorer, Wytheville, Virginia to Eliza Rhorer, [unknown]. 9 January 1893.

scopecontent.p: Re: death of Polly Cooper; call of Rev. T. P. Barclay to Wytheville Presbyterian Church; healthy climate of Wytheville.

did.unittitle: Notice. John H. Puckett, Bank of Ivanhoe, Ivanhoe, Virginia to W. H. Slater. 12 June 1923.
Check. Nannie B. Slater, First National Bank, Wytheville, Virginia. 23 February 1924.
